Module ing.sw.puddu.rios.rizzo
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.cli

Class RectangleCLI

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.view.cli.RectangleCLI
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CanvasCLI
    public class RectangleCLI
extends java.lang.Object
    The basic printable entity for the CLI graphics.

    • Method Detail

      • createInRelativeFrame

        public RectangleCLI createInRelativeFrame​(int x,
                                          int y,
                                          int sideX,
                                          int sideY)
        Factory method useful to design figures in a relative position to an existing one.
        Parameters:
        x - the desired horizontal delta whit respect to the object the method is called on.
        y - the desired vertical delta whit respect to the object the method is called on.
        sideX - the horizontal side of the desired figure.
        sideY - the vertical side of the desired figure.
        Returns:
        the new RectangleCLI object.

      • addOverlappingFigure

        void addOverlappingFigure​(RectangleCLI figure)
        Adds a new figure as overlapping, meaning that it will be printed on the top of this. Multiple overlapping figures are allowed, but every new figure is added as top layer.
        Parameters:
        figure - the overlapping RectangleCLI object.

      • addText

        void addText​(java.lang.String s)
        Adds text to be printed on this.
        Parameters:
        s - the text to be printed.

      • setPalette

        void setPalette​(java.lang.String... colors)
        Sets a set of colors to be mapped on the texture.
        Parameters:
        colors - a set of color strings.

      • setMask

        void setMask​(java.lang.String URI)
        Sets a texture mask to be mapped on the local palette.
        Parameters:
        URI - the location of the text file storing the mask.

      • isItIn

        boolean isItIn​(int x,
               int y)
        Checks if a pair of coordinates belongs to this rectangle's area, considered in the canvas frame.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate, considered in the canvas frame.
        y - the y coordinate, considered in the canvas frame.
        Returns:
        true if the considered position is in the rectangle, else otherwise.

      • hasText

        boolean hasText()
        Checks if this rectangle has some text on it.
        Returns:
        true if text has been set on this.

      • hasOverlapHere

        boolean hasOverlapHere​(int x,
                       int y)
        Checks if this has overlapping figures in a certain point.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate, considered in the canvas frame.
        y - the y coordinate, considered in the canvas frame.
        Returns:
        true if this has overlapping figures in the defined position.

      • getTopLayerText

        java.lang.String getTopLayerText​(int x,
                                 int y)
        Recursively compute the top layer's text in a certain position.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate, considered in the canvas frame.
        y - the y coordinate, considered in the canvas frame.
        Returns:
        the text if present, a blank string otherwise.

      • getTopLayerColor

        java.lang.String getTopLayerColor​(int x,
                                  int y)
        Recursively compute the top layer's background color in a certain position.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate, considered in the canvas frame.
        y - the y coordinate, considered in the canvas frame.
        Returns:
        the ANSI color string.

      • getColor

        java.lang.String getColor​(int x,
                          int y)
        Gets the background color of a determinate point of this.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate, considered in the canvas frame.
        y - the y coordinate, considered in the canvas frame.
        Returns:
        the ANSI color string.

      • getBG

        protected static java.lang.String getBG​(char[][] mask,
                                        java.lang.String[] palette,
                                        int x,
                                        int y)
        Actually computes the background color in a certain position, mapping the palette on the texture mask.
        Parameters:
        mask - a matrix of chars representing the color in every point of the figure.
        palette - a set of color strings.
        x - the x coordinate, considered in the local frame.
        y - the y coordinate, considered in the local frame.
        Returns:
        the ANSI color string.

      • getChunks

        protected static java.lang.String[] getChunks​(java.lang.String text)
        Splits a single string in an array of multiple strings of length 3. This is needed to correctly display the text on the picture, as the basic printable unit is composed of chars.
        Parameters:
        text - the original string to be split up.
        Returns:
        the array of strings.

      • setDefaultPalette

        protected java.lang.String[] setDefaultPalette()
        Initialize the palette field with a white background color.
        Returns:
        the newly created palette.

      • setDefaultMask

        protected char[][] setDefaultMask()
        Initialize the mask field with an empty texture composed only by one background color.
        Returns:
        the newly created mask.

      • obtainMask

        protected static char[][] obtainMask​(java.lang.String URI)
        Extract the mask from the text file storing it.
        Parameters:
        URI - the location of the file.
        Returns:
        the char matrix representing the texture.

      • XInRelativeFrame

        protected int XInRelativeFrame​(int x)
        Converts x coordinate from the canvas frame to the local frame.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate, considered in the canvas frame.
        Returns:
        the converted coordinate.

      • YInRelativeFrame

        protected int YInRelativeFrame​(int y)
        Converts y coordinate from the canvas frame to the local frame.
        Parameters:
        y - the y coordinate, considered in the canvas frame.
        Returns:
        the converted coordinate.
